title: Sheridan Smith FRIENDS with child-snatcher Karen Matthews’ pal after starring in Shannon Matthews drama
text:
Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
The BBC’s much-anticipated Shannon Matthews drama, The Moorside, starring Sheridan Smith starts on Monday night. 
The drama tells the story of the Yorkshire schoolgirl who was reported missing - only for it then to be discovered she’d been kidnapped by her own mum. 
And Sheridan has now revealed the shocking news she’s become FRIENDS with Julie Bushby, the woman who helped child abductor Karen Matthews since portraying her in the two-part drama. 
The Funny Girl actress confessed she’s even grown to love the mum of three, despite Julie still standing by Karen, who kidnapped her own daughter Shannon in 2008. Read More Sheridan Smith is playing Julie Bushby in the Shannon Matthews drama (Photo: BBC) And she's now friends with the real Julie Bushby (Photo: Andy Stenning/Daily Mirror) Julie stood by Karen Matthews when she abducted her own daughter (Photo: Phil Spencer) 
Sheridan told The Sun : “Julie never wanted to see bad of Karen. She never wanted to give up hope. Me and Julie are still friends. 
“I’ve got such admiration for everyone on that estate, but especially Julie. 
“She’s stronger than I am. She helped me with the whole journey all along.” Read More Shannon Matthews was abducted by her mum Karen (Photo: PA) Karen had been campaigning to find her daughter (Photo: Phil Harris/Daily Mirror) 
Sheridan will star alongside Game Of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan as Karen in The Moorside, while Sherlock star Sian Brooke will play their neighbour Natalie. 
Shannon, who was nine at the time of her abduction, was missing for nearly a month and was found in a house that belonged to Michael Donovan, uncle of Craig Meehan — Karen’s paedophile boyfriend. 
The kidnapping was subsequently discovered to have been planned by Karen and Michael to make money from the publicity. 
Both were found guilty of kidnap, false imprisonment, and perverting the course of justice and given eight-year jail terms. 
The Moorside, however, will focus on the community behind the Shannon Matthews story and Julie’s guilt after helping get her friend convicted. Sheridan Smith plays Julie in The Moorside Project (Photo: MCPIX) 
And Sheridan revealed the BBC drama got Julie’s seal of approval, adding: “Julie said: ‘It were brilliant’.” 
Writer Neil McKay added: “When Julie first met Sheridan, she had a cup of coffee and a cigarette and Julie looked at her and said, ‘She’s shooting up in my estimation’.” 
*The Moorside airs on BBC One on Tuesday 7 February at 9pm Like us on Facebook
